title: Typeface of the 'Cacharel' Logo
content:
Hi All,

The Cacharel Logo has probably been created for the Label. But does anyone know a Typeface which comes close to it? We already checked the Bodoni Poster but it feels to heavy and masculine, specially on the endings.

Bests/  
Philippe
author: Philippe@Basedesign

comments.content:
It's closer to Bodoni No. 2, but that font lacks the curves of the logo.  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayf...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141122152654/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.100626.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=74&sampleText=cacharel&sampleSize=60 "http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.100626.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=74&sampleText=cacharel&sampleSize=60")

Galoman, maybe try Didoni URW, it's not that close but maybe it can help you...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/?PREFS\_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=72&PR...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141122152654/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=72&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=BJORK "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/?PREFS\_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=72&PREFS\_SET%5BRenderString%5D=BJORK")
